head.supplied: 17/12/85 ¶ ¶ This morning, dear Mr Macdonald, I received the byefollowing letter from Mr Maiden. ¶ What do you think should be done concerning the expenses of any of the Exploration-party ¶ coming ...

div.p: A38 Royal Geographical Society of Australasia (Vic. Branch) papers, Mitchell Library, Sydney.

This morning, dear Mr Macdonald, I received the byefollowing letter from Mr Maiden.
Letter not found. What do you think should be done concerning the expenses of any of the Exploration-party
The Royal Geographical Society of Australasia's New Guinea exploring expedition, which returned safely to Sydney on 3 December 1885 after earlier reports that the whole party had been massacred. The Victorian Branch of the Society hoped to hold a reception in the middle of January 1886 to welcome some members of the expedition in Melbourne; see M to E. Strickland, 9 December 1885 (in this edition as 85-12-09a). coming here? Do you think, the Hon. the Premier
James Service. would be able to grant us out of any vote so[me] little means for the purpose.
